message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.RO. 

The paper proposes a neural language grounding module for embodied agents that can be trained end to end from scratch taking raw pixels, unstructured linguistic commands, and sparse rewards as the inputs. This involves deep reinforcement learning, natural language processing, and computer vision. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper also involves deep learning techniques, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category. The use of raw pixels as input suggests the involvement of computer vision, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper also involves navigation tasks, which suggests the involvement of robotics, making cs.RO (Robotics) a possible sub-category.
